p:
To determine the average number of TFEOH equivalents involved in the overall two-electron BQ redox response from the CV titration data ( Fig. 2 and S4 †), the slope of the − E 1/2 (V vs. Fc +/Fc) versus log[TFEOH (M)] was used in the concentration region where the feature remained reversible (−0.85 V to −0.70 V). The slope of this plot can be used to determine the number of TFEOH molecules x which associate to the [BQ] 2− dianion, where n is the number of electrons involved (2), F is Faradays' constant (96 485 C mol −1), R is the ideal gas constant (J K −1 mol −1), T is temperature (K), eqn (8).
8
